com.ixortalk.udini.android.sdk

Class UdiniApp

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ixortalk.udini.android.sdk.UdiniApp

  • public class UdiniApp
extends java.lang.Object
    Udini iOS top-level class. Provides facilities to start and stop all udini services.

    Copyright Â© 2018 ixor. All rights reserved.

    • Method Detail

      • sharedInstance

        public static UdiniApp sharedInstance(android.content.Context context)
        Returns the singleton instance of the Udini SDK for Android.

      • getOptions

        public UdiniOptions getOptions()
        Returns the currently set of configured options for the SDK. Note that you can use the returned immutable instance to create a mutable one that can be passed into configureWithOptions(UdiniOptions).

      • configureWithOptions

        public UdiniApp configureWithOptions(UdiniOptions options)
        Configures the default Udini app with the provided options and automatically starts the UdiniService singleton.

        This method will dispatch a configuration change event on the event bus. Subscribers will always receive UdiniCallback.onUdiniServiceStarted() UdiniCallback.onUdiniStartedScanningDevices(List), even if the service was already running. This is to indicate the new options have taken effect.

      • registerCallback

        public UdiniApp registerCallback(UdiniCallback callback)
        Registers a callback to start receiving Udini events.
        See Also:
        unregisterCallback(UdiniCallback)

      • unregisterCallback

        public UdiniApp unregisterCallback(UdiniCallback callback)
        Unregisters a callback previously registered with registerCallback(UdiniCallback)

      • invalidateBadgesCache

        public void invalidateBadgesCache()
        Invalidates the badge cache.

      • start

        public void start()
        This will start all configured Udini services. Calling this method is equivalent to calling start(false).

      • start

        public void start(boolean background)
        This will start all configured Udini services. The argument determines whether or not to start the service in the foreground or the background.

        This method will dispatch a configuration change event on the event bus. Subscribers will always receive UdiniCallback.onUdiniServiceStarted() UdiniCallback.onUdiniStartedScanningDevices(List), even if the service was already running.

        This distinction is a specific Android feature. In case the caller passed true to indicate the service should be run in the background this method will start a dedicated Android foreground service. Yes, this name is confusing since it is about running the service in the background, however, the foreground part is about having the service visible in the form of a notification icon in your mobile device's notification area.
        Parameters:
        background - whether or not to start the Udini services in the background
        See Also:
        stop()

      • stop

        public void stop()
        This will stop all configured Udini services.

        This method will dispatch a configuration change event on the event bus. Subscribers will receive UdiniCallback.onUdiniServiceStopped() UdiniCallback.onUdiniStoppedScanningDevices(List) in case the service was running while this method was called.
        See Also:
        start()

      • login

        public void login(android.content.Context context)
        Starts the OAuth2 login flow using the given Android context.

      • logout

        public void logout(android.content.Context context)
        Starts the OAuth2 logout flow using the given Android context. This will also stop the UdiniService in case it was running, and remove any persisted state related to the currently logged in user.

        Calling this method while not logged in will have no specific effect other than having the internal logout activity quickly popup.
        See Also:
        stop()

      • getKeyPairTimestamp

        public java.util.Date getKeyPairTimestamp()
        Returns the most recent time the client keys have successfully been uploaded to the server. The upload is done automatically by the SDK the moment after you have logged in.
        Returns:
        null in case no user is currently logged in, or no upload has been done yet

      • getUserProfile

        public UdiniUserProfile getUserProfile()
        Returns the most recently downloaded user profile. Calling this method will not issue a request to the server.
        Returns:
        null in case no user is currently logged in, or the user profile has never been downloaded for the current user
        See Also:
        getUserProfile(boolean, GetUserProfileCallback)

      • getUserProfile

        public void getUserProfile(boolean useCache,
                           UdiniApp.GetUserProfileCallback callback)
        Returns the user profile for the currently logged in user. It is expected that a user has been logged in before calling this method. Otherwise the argument callback will receive an exception argument.

        When the useCache parameter is true and the user profile has been downloaded before this method will not issue a request to the server and will simply return the cached instance, equivalent to getUserProfile().

        In any other case this method will query the server for the current user's profile and return it via UdiniApp.GetUserProfileCallback.onUdiniUserProfile(UdiniUserProfile, int, Throwable).

      • getBadges

        public java.util.List<UdiniBadge> getBadges()
        Returns the most recently downloaded list of badges associated with the current user. Calling this method will not issue a request to the server.
        Returns:
        null in case no user is currently logged in, or the list of badges has never been downloaded for the current user
        See Also:
        getBadges(boolean, GetBadgesCallback)

      • getBadges

        public void getBadges(boolean useCache,
                      UdiniApp.GetBadgesCallback callback)
        Returns the list of badges for the currently logged in user. It is expected that a user has been logged in before calling this method. Otherwise the argument callback will receive an exception argument.

        When the useCache parameter is true and the list of badges has been downloaded before this method will not issue a request to the server and will simply return the cached instance, equivalent to getBadges().

        In any other case this method will query the server for the current user's list of badges and return it via UdiniApp.GetBadgesCallback.onUdiniBadges(List, int, Throwable).

      • updateProfilePicture

        public void updateProfilePicture(java.io.File imageFile,
                                 UdiniApp.UpdateProfilePictureCallback callback,
                                 UdiniApp.UploadProgressCallback progressCallback)
        This method allows you to update profile picture for the current user. It is expected that a user has been logged in before calling this method. Otherwise the argument callback will receive an exception argument.

        Success/failure information will be returned via UdiniApp.UpdateProfilePictureCallback.onUdiniProfilePicture(boolean, int, Throwable) while progress indication is returned via UdiniApp.UploadProgressCallback.onUdiniUploadProgress(int).

      • invokeAction

        public void invokeAction(UdiniBadge badge,
                         UdiniDevice device,
                         UdiniAction action)
        Invokes a specific action on the given device. It depends on the infrastructure how this action will be executed. If allowed the SDK will attempt to use a remote call over HTTP to trigger it, else communication over Bluetooth will be initiated to achieve the same result.
        Parameters:
        badge - The badge the device is linked to
        device - The Udini BLE device you want to invoke the action
        action - The specified action you want to invoke on the device

      • createIntentForInvokeAction

        public android.app.PendingIntent createIntentForInvokeAction(UdiniBadge badge,
                                                             UdiniDevice device,
                                                             UdiniAction action,
                                                             int requestCode)
        Convenient method for clients to issue actions on the device from custom code. As opposed to the invokeAction(UdiniBadge, UdiniDevice, UdiniAction) method this way of dispatching requests does not use an optimized channel for communication but calls the UdiniService directly. Use this method when you need to invoke action from the notification drawer.
